page.title: 07History around Laggan
page.content: A most important event takes place in Laggan this year(1985). Our kirk celebrates it's 200th anniversary although now the only church, there were this century 2 other congregations in the village. The Free church of Scotland remains only as a steeple,while the Roman Catholic Church was demolished and taken to Elgin.The manse of the old Free Kirk is now a hotel.The present schoolhouse was the registrars house and office until 1930. Older residents have been heard to call this "the poor office". At Balgowan(east of block) there are 2 houses which were the local poor house. Just beyond our western border are the remains of 2 important settlements. On Dun da Lamb are remains of an iron-age Pictish fort. Across the Spey can be seen the ruins of the clarance village of Crathie.
